snippet: Morgan Stanley is paying for its role in the troubled stock market debut of Facebook, report Susanne Craig and Ben Protess on Tuesday in The New York Times. On Monday, Massachusetts's top financial authority fined the bank $5 million for violating...
abstract: Morgan Stanley is paying for its role in the troubled stock market debut of Facebook, report Susanne Craig and Ben Protess on Tuesday in The New York Times. On Monday, Massachusetts's top financial authority fined the bank $5 million for violating securities laws, the first major regulatory action tied to Facebook's initial public stock offering.

headline.main: Daily Report: Massachusetts Fines Morgan Stanley Over Facebook I.P.O.
